alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southern West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Buchanan. In southern West Virginia, McDowell, Mingo and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect some areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM EDT, emergency management and the public reported flooding in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gilbert Creek, R.d. Bailey Lake, Hanover, Hinch, Gilbert, Panther, Hampden, Meador and Edgarton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
